story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Pony Xpress land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Pony Xpress? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Pony Xpress scored 59 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Pony Xpress. Cokedale, Colorado. 100 mi. Rolling high desert and foothills gravel through Sangre de Cristo mining country.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Serious elevation. Train your climbing legs. 4,500 feet of climbing over 100 miles with a range from 6,000 to 8,800 feet elevation. Altitude. 4 out of 5. High enough to affect your power. Plan for it. Starting at 6,000 feet and maxing out at 8,800 feet will humble sea-level riders quickly. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. 100 miles with 7,300 feet of climbing hits serious gravel distance territory. Climate. 3 out of 5. Pack for two seasons. 50°F start to 75°F midday in May is nearly perfect gravel weather. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Prestige. 3 out of 5. Respected. Not yet legendary. Part of the Colorado Gravel Grinder Championships series, but nobody's talking about it online. Race Quality. 3 out of 5. Solid production value. 90% gravel county roads through Las Animas County with proper feed stations and organization. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. Rolling through wooded forests and mining areas with Fisher Peak views, 70% sheltered from wind by trees and canyons.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Community. 3 out of 5. Genuine community feel. People stick around. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Standard gravel race budget. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

strengths: Part of Colorado Gravel Grinder Championships series
Historic mining country and Ludlow Memorial

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Trinidad 30 min, or Denver 4 hours
Lodging: Cokedale has minimal lodging. Trinidad has more options. Fairgrounds camping $25/night.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Remote Southern Colorado Gravel Grinder. If you're in Colorado and want a remote gravel adventure through mining history at altitude. yes, it's a well-organized event with serious terrain. If you're from out of state. there are more accessible events with deeper fields.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Pony Xpress isn't quite right for you. For bigger Colorado events: SBT GRVL, Steamboat Gravel. For similar remote Colorado gravel: Ned Gravel, Grit & Gravel. For championship-level gravel: Unbound, BWR.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Pony Xpress? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Pony Xpress' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
